revised_title: Argon Vacuum Wave-Length Measurements Using Reflecting Echelons
tldr: The authors conducted experiments using two reflecting echelons to measure the vacuum wave-lengths of 84 lines in the argon spectrum. They found that the values obtained were independent of the particular instrument employed and established that non-linearity of dispersion did not require correction in the visible and ultra-violet regions of the spectrum. This study contributed to the development of secondary vacuum wave-length standards.
